statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Oral Roberts 85, Centenary 80
article.story: TULSA, Okla. (AP) -- Caleb Green sank two tiebreaking free throws with 34 seconds left to propel Oral Roberts past Centenary 85-80 on Thursday night. Ken Tutt had 25 points and Green scored 20 for the Golden Eagles (19-8, 11-1), who clinched a share of the Mid-Continent Conference regular-season title. Tutt was 6-of-10 from the field and 10-of-12 on free throws. Green was 6-of-9 and 8-of-10, respectively. Tyrone Hamilton and Alexander Starr scored 20 points each to lead the Gents (9-18, 3-9), who overcame a 48-33 halftime deficit to take a 63-62 lead on a Chase Adams' trey with 9:28 left. The lead seesawed throughout the rest of the game with the final margin being the largest of the last 13 minutes. Adam Liberty had three treys in the final 6:43 to help ORU take an 80-76 lead with three minutes left. The Gents countered with layups by Lance Hill and Nick Stallings to tie the game at 80 with 48 seconds remaining. After Green gave ORU an 82-80 lead, Starr missed a driving shot. Tutt grabbed the rebound and was fouled with 11 seconds left. After Tutt made one of two free throws, Hamilton had the ball stripped away at midcourt by Yemi Ogunoye, who was fouled intentionally on a breakaway dunk with two seconds remaining. Ogunoye was shaken up and could not shoot the free throws. Moses Ehambe filled in and made both free shots to seal the outcome. Hill scored 17 for Centenary, which lost to ORU for the second time this season.
